page.title: 03RAGLAN CASTLE GWENT
page.content: { RAGLAN CASTLE GWENT} Raglan castle and grounds covers an area of nine and a half acres.The Duke of Beaufort who owns the castle is now its hereditary keeper. The Welsh Office,through Cadw, looks after the castle.It has over 70,000 visitors a year who come from all over the world. The castle was originally a Motte & Bailey built in the 11th century. The present castle was built in the 14th & late 15th century.During the Civil War 1646 the castle was under seige for ten weeks.The highest part of the castle is the Great Tower,and some of the castles main attractions are the Grand Staircase,the well and the moat stocked with goldfish. There is a large car park in the castle grounds and a picnic area.
